00029 enum FileTypes
00030 {
00032         None = 0,
00033 
00035         BlockSpecialFile = 1 << 0,
00037         CharacterSpecialFile = 1 << 1,
00039         Directory = 1 << 2,
00041         NamedPipe = 1 << 3,
00043         RegularFile = 1 << 4,
00045         SymbolicLink = 1 << 5,
00047         Socket = 1 << 6,
00048 };

00119 int main(int argc, char* argv[])
00120 {
00121         struct Args* args = calloc(1, sizeof(struct Args));
00122 
00123         if (args == NULL)
00124         {
00125                 // Out of memory
00126                 return -1;
00127         }
00128 
00129         // Parse and validate the command line arguments
00130         if (!ParseCommandLineArgs(argv, args))
00131         {
00132                 PrintUsage();
00133 
00134                 free(args);
00135 
00136                 return -1;
00137         }
00138 
00139 
00140         // Search in the current working directory if no corresponding argument was provided
00141         char* searchPath = (args->searchPath == NULL)
00142                 ? "."
00143                 : args->searchPath;
00144 
00145         // Start the search at the specified path
00146         SearchFile(searchPath, args);
00147 
00148         free(args);
00149 
00150         return 0;
00151 }
00152 
00154 void PrintUsage()
00155 {
00156         printf("\n");
00157         printf("myfind - Prints files that match an arbitrary combination of search criteria.\n\n");
00158         printf("Usage:\n");
00159         printf("    find <file or directory> [<action>] ...\n");
00160         printf("<action> can one or more of:\n");
00161         printf("    -print                  Simply prints the path of the found files, as if no action was given.\n");
00162         printf("    -ls                     Prints found files in extended list format.\n");
00163         printf("    -type [bcdpfls]         Prints only files of the specified types:\n");
00164         printf("        b ... Block special files\n");
00165         printf("        c ... Character special files\n");
00166         printf("        d ... Directories\n");
00167         printf("        p ... Named pipes\n");
00168         printf("        f ... Regular files\n");
00169         printf("        l ... Symbolic links\n");
00170         printf("        s ... Sockets\n");
00171         printf("    -user <name>/<uid>      Prints only files belonging to the user with the specified name or ID.\n");
00172         printf("    -nouser                 Prints only files that do not belong to any user.\n");
00173         printf("    -name <pattern>         Prints only files whose name matches the specified pattern.\n");
00174         printf("    -path <pattern>         Prints only files whose complete path matches the specified pattern.\n");
00175 }

00177 
00182 bool ParseCommandLineArgs(char* argv[], struct Args *args)
00183 {
00184         assert(argv != NULL);
00185         assert(args != NULL);
00186 
00187 
00188         // The first argument is the executable path; Start processing with the second argument
00189         int i = 1;
00190 
00191         while (argv[i] != NULL)
00192         {
00193                 if (strcmp(argv[i], "-print") == 0)
00194                 {
00195                         // This argument does not have any effect on the application's behavior; Nothing to do
00196                 }
00197                 else if (strcmp(argv[i], "-ls") == 0)
00198                 {
00199                         // Simply set the flag
00200                         args->printInExtendedFormat = true;
00201                 }
00202                 else if (strcmp(argv[i], "-type") == 0)
00203                 {
00204                         // Make sure that this argument is followed by another one
00205                         char* fileTypes = argv[i + 1];
00206 
00207                         if (fileTypes == NULL)
00208                         {
00209                                 fprintf(stderr, "Argument error: \"-type\" must be followed by one or more concatenated file type characters.\n");
00210 
00211                                 return false;
00212                         }
00213 
00214                         if (!ParseFileTypes(fileTypes, &args->fileTypes))
00215                         {
00216                                 fprintf(stderr, "Argument error: The specified file types \"%s\" are invalid.\n", fileTypes);
00217 
00218                                 return false;
00219                         }
00220 
00221                         // Indicate that we want to filter for the specified file types
00222                         args->filterByFileType = true;
00223 
00224                         // Skip the file types argument 
00225                         i++;
00226                 }
00227                 else if (strcmp(argv[i], "-user") == 0)
00228                 {
00229                         // Make sure that this argument is followed by another one
00230                         char* userNameOrID = argv[i + 1];
00231 
00232                         if (userNameOrID == NULL)
00233                         {
00234                                 fprintf(stderr, "Argument error: \"-user\" must be followed by the name or ID of a user.\n");
00235 
00236                                 return false;
00237                         }
00238 
00239                         if (ConvertToInteger(userNameOrID, &args->userID))
00240                         {
00241                                 // The user was specified by their numeric user ID; Nothing more to do
00242                         }
00243                         else if (QueryUserID(userNameOrID, &args->userID))
00244                         {
00245                                 // The user was specified by their user name for which the corresponding ID could be queried successfully; Nothing more to do
00246                         }
00247                         else
00248                         {
00249                                 fprintf(stderr, "Argument error: The user ID for user name \"%s\" could not be retrieved.\n", userNameOrID);
00250 
00251                                 return false;
00252                         }
00253 
00254                         // Indicate that we want to filter for the determined user ID
00255                         args->filterByUserID = true;
00256 
00257                         // Skip the user name/ID argument 
00258                         i++;
00259                 }
00260                 else if (strcmp(argv[i], "-nouser") == 0)
00261                 {
00262                         // Simply set the flag
00263                         args->filterForNoUser = true;
00264                 }
00265                 else if (strcmp(argv[i], "-name") == 0)
00266                 {
00267                         // Make sure that this argument is followed by another one
00268                         char* namePattern = argv[i + 1];
00269 
00270                         if (namePattern == NULL)
00271                         {
00272                                 fprintf(stderr, "Argument error: \"-name\" must be followed by a string representing the filter pattern to apply for the file name.\n");
00273 
00274                                 return false;
00275                         }
00276 
00277                         // Store a pointer to the pattern and set the flag that it is available
00278                         args->namePattern = namePattern;
00279                         args->filterForNamePattern = true;
00280 
00281                         // Skip the name pattern argument 
00282                         i++;
00283                 }
00284                 else if (strcmp(argv[i], "-path") == 0)
00285                 {
00286                         // Make sure that this argument is followed by another one
00287                         char* pathPattern = argv[i + 1];
00288 
00289                         if (pathPattern == NULL)
00290                         {
00291                                 fprintf(stderr, "Argument error - \"-path\" must be followed by a string representing the filter pattern to apply for the file path.\n");
00292 
00293                                 return false;
00294                         }
00295 
00296                         // Store a pointer to the pattern and set the flag that it is available
00297                         args->pathPattern = pathPattern;
00298                         args->filterForPathPattern = true;
00299 
00300                         // Skip the path pattern argument 
00301                         i++;
00302                 }
00303                 else if (i == 1)
00304                 {
00305                         // If this argument does not match any of the actions but is the first one, assume that it is the search path
00306                         args->searchPath = argv[i];
00307                 }
00308                 else
00309                 {
00310                         fprintf(stderr, "Argument error: Unknown argument %d, \"%s\".\n", i, argv[i]);
00311 
00312                         return false;
00313                 }
00314 
00315                 i++;
00316         }
00317 
00318         // All arguments were parsed successfully
00319         return true;
00320 }
00321 
00326 bool ParseFileTypes(char* fileTypeChars, enum FileTypes* fileTypes)
00327 {
00328         assert(fileTypeChars != NULL);
00329         assert(fileTypes != NULL);
00330 
00331 
00332         // Assume no file type by default
00333         *fileTypes = None;
00334 
00335         // Loop through the individual characters in the string
00336         for (size_t i = 0; i < strlen(fileTypeChars); i++)
00337         {
00338                 switch (fileTypeChars[i])
00339                 {
00340                 case 'b':
00341                         *fileTypes |= BlockSpecialFile;
00342                         break;
00343 
00344                 case 'c':
00345                         *fileTypes |= CharacterSpecialFile;
00346                         break;
00347 
00348                 case 'd':
00349                         *fileTypes |= Directory;
00350                         break;
00351 
00352                 case 'p':
00353                         *fileTypes |= NamedPipe;
00354                         break;
00355 
00356                 case 'f':
00357                         *fileTypes |= RegularFile;
00358                         break;
00359 
00360                 case 'l':
00361                         *fileTypes |= SymbolicLink;
00362                         break;
00363 
00364                 case 's':
00365                         *fileTypes |= Socket;
00366                         break;
00367 
00368                 default:
00369                         // Invalid character
00370                         return false;
00371                 }
00372         }
00373 
00374         // All characters could be parsed successfully
00375         return true;
00376 }

00401 void SearchFile(char* filePath, struct Args* args)
00402 {
00403         assert(filePath != NULL);
00404         assert(args != NULL);
00405 
00406 
00407         struct stat fileInfo;
00408 
00409         // Read the file information without following symbolic links
00410         int result = lstat(filePath, &fileInfo);
00411 
00412         if (result == -1)
00413         {
00414                 fprintf(stderr, "Reading information of file \"%s\" has failed with error code %d: %s\n", filePath, errno, strerror(errno));
00415 
00416                 return;
00417         }
00418 
00419 
00420         // Check if the file should be ignored based on the command line arguments
00421         if (ShouldPrintFileInformation(filePath, &fileInfo, args))
00422         {
00423                 // Print the information of this file or directory
00424                 PrintFileInformation(filePath, &fileInfo, args);
00425         }
00426 
00427         // Continue the search in subdirectories if the "file" is actually a directory
00428         if (S_ISDIR(fileInfo.st_mode))
00429         {
00430                 SearchDirectory(filePath, args);
00431         }
00432 }
00433 
00437 void SearchDirectory(char* directoryPath, struct Args* args)
00438 {
00439         assert(directoryPath != NULL);
00440         assert(args != NULL);
00441 
00442 
00443         // Open the specified directory
00444         DIR* pDir = opendir(directoryPath);
00445 
00446         if (pDir == NULL)
00447         {
00448                 fprintf(stderr, "Opening directory \"%s\" has failed with error code %d: %s\n", directoryPath, errno, strerror(errno));
00449 
00450                 return;
00451         }
00452 
00453 
00454         // If we keep the current directory open while descending further
00455         // down the directory tree, we might run into the open file limit.
00456         // Therefore, we will read all entries of the current directory
00457         // into a linked list and close the directory right away.
00458 
00459         // The head of the linked list that stores the file names of the current directory
00460         struct FileNode* head = NULL;
00461 
00462         struct dirent* directoryInfo = NULL;
00463 
00464         do
00465         {
00466                 // Reset error for the subsequent library call
00467                 errno = 0;
00468 
00469                 // Read directory information
00470                 directoryInfo = readdir(pDir);
00471 
00472                 if (directoryInfo == NULL)
00473                 {
00474                         // If no error value is set, it indicates that the end of the directory stream has been reached
00475                         if (errno != 0)
00476                                 fprintf(stderr, "Reading directory \"%s\" has failed with error code %d: %s\n", directoryPath, errno, strerror(errno));
00477 
00478                         break;
00479                 }
00480 
00481                 // Ignore the directory entries that represent the current and the parent directory
00482                 if ((strcmp(directoryInfo->d_name, ".") == 0) || (strcmp(directoryInfo->d_name, "..") == 0))
00483                         continue;
00484 
00485 
00486                 // Add the directory name to the temporary list
00487                 AddListNode(&head, directoryInfo->d_name);
00488         } while (directoryInfo != NULL);
00489 
00490 
00491         // Close the directory
00492         int result = closedir(pDir);
00493 
00494         if (result == -1)
00495         {
00496                 fprintf(stderr, "Closing directory \"%s\" has failed with error code %d: %s\n", directoryPath, errno, strerror(errno));
00497 
00498                 return;
00499         }
00500 
00501 
00502         // Iterate over the list of file names 
00503         struct FileNode* node = head;
00504 
00505         while (node != NULL)
00506         {
00507                 // TODO:
00508                 // CombinePath() might be unnecessary since the file system accepts duplicated
00509                 // slashes in paths (".////doc" will be treated the same as "./doc"). Simply
00510                 // concatenate directoryPath and directoryInfo->d_name with a slash in between.
00511 
00512                 // Construct the combined path of the file, taking care of duplicated slashes
00513                 char* filePath = CombinePath(directoryPath, node->fileName);
00514 
00515                 // Process files and directories below the current one
00516                 SearchFile(filePath, args);
00517 
00518                 // Free the previously allocated, combined path string
00519                 free(filePath);
00520 
00521 
00522                 // Continue with the next entry in the list
00523                 node = node->next;
00524         }
00525 
00526         // Free the temporary list
00527         FreeList(&head);
00528 }

00530 
00535 char* CombinePath(char* path1, char* path2)
00536 {
00537         // Determine the number of characters in the input strings
00538         int path1Len = strlen(path1);
00539         int path2Len = strlen(path2);
00540 
00541         // Check if both or either of the strings is empty
00542         if ((path1Len == 0) && (path2Len == 0))
00543         {
00544                 return strdup("");
00545         }
00546         else if (path1Len == 0)
00547         {
00548                 return strdup(path2);
00549         }
00550         else if (path2Len == 0)
00551         {
00552                 return strdup(path1);
00553         }
00554 
00555 
00556         // Allocate sufficient memory for concatenating the paths plus the directory separator and string terminator
00557         char* combined = calloc(path1Len + path2Len + 2, sizeof(char));
00558 
00559         if (combined == NULL)
00560         {
00561                 // Out of memory
00562                 exit(-1);
00563         }
00564 
00565 
00566         // Check if the first path ends with a directory-separating slash
00567         int path1HasTrailingSlash =
00568                 (path1Len > 0) && (path1[path1Len - 1] == '/');
00569 
00570         // Check if the second path starts with a directory-separating slash
00571         int path2HasLeadingSlash =
00572                 (path2Len > 0) && (path2[0] == '/');
00573 
00574         if (path1HasTrailingSlash && path2HasLeadingSlash)
00575         {
00576                 // Both paths contain a slash; Trim the slash from the first path and concatenate
00577                 strncat(combined, path1, path1Len - 1);
00578                 strcat(combined, path2);
00579         }
00580         else if (path1HasTrailingSlash || path2HasLeadingSlash)
00581         {
00582                 // Only one path contains a slash; Concatenate the paths as they are
00583                 strcat(combined, path1);
00584                 strcat(combined, path2);
00585         }
00586         else
00587         {
00588                 // Neither path contains a slash; Concatenate the paths with a slash in between
00589                 strcat(combined, path1);
00590                 strcat(combined, "/");
00591                 strcat(combined, path2);
00592         }
00593 
00594         return combined;
00595 }

00597 
00602 struct FileNode* AddListNode(struct FileNode** head, char* fileName)
00603 {
00604         assert(head != NULL);
00605         assert(fileName != NULL);
00606 
00607 
00608         // Create the new node
00609         struct FileNode* node = malloc(sizeof(struct FileNode));
00610 
00611         if (node == NULL)
00612         {
00613                 // Out of memory
00614                 exit(-1);
00615         }
00616 
00617         node->fileName = strdup(fileName);
00618         node->next = NULL;
00619 
00620 
00621         // Add the node to the list
00622         if (*head == NULL)
00623         {
00624                 // This is the first element
00625                 *head = node;
00626         }
00627         else
00628         {
00629                 // Find the last node in the list
00630                 struct FileNode* tail = *head;
00631 
00632                 while (tail->next != NULL)
00633                         tail = tail->next;
00634 
00635                 // Add the new node at the end of the list
00636                 tail->next = node;
00637         }
00638 
00639         return node;
00640 }
00641 
00644 void FreeList(struct FileNode** head)
00645 {
00646         assert(head != NULL);
00647 
00648 
00649         // Keep freeing nodes until all have been removed
00650         while (*head != NULL)
00651         {
00652                 // Preserve a pointer to the current head
00653                 struct FileNode* current = *head;
00654 
00655                 // Advance the head to the next node
00656                 *head = (*head)->next;
00657 
00658                 // Free the previous head
00659                 free(current->fileName);
00660                 free(current);
00661         }
00662 }

00669 bool ShouldPrintFileInformation(char* filePath, struct stat* fileInformation, struct Args* args)
00670 {
00671         assert(filePath != NULL);
00672         assert(fileInformation != NULL);
00673         assert(args != NULL);
00674 
00675 
00676         // TODO:
00677         // Apply the command line actions to determine whether this file should
00678         // be ignored. Exit without printing any information in that case.
00679 
00680         if (args->filterByFileType)
00681         {
00682                 // Return whether the file is of any of the types specified in args
00683                 return
00684                         (S_ISBLK(fileInformation->st_mode) && (args->fileTypes & BlockSpecialFile)) ||
00685                         (S_ISCHR(fileInformation->st_mode) && (args->fileTypes & CharacterSpecialFile)) ||
00686                         (S_ISDIR(fileInformation->st_mode) && (args->fileTypes & Directory)) ||
00687                         (S_ISFIFO(fileInformation->st_mode) && (args->fileTypes & NamedPipe)) ||
00688                         (S_ISREG(fileInformation->st_mode) && (args->fileTypes & RegularFile)) ||
00689                         (S_ISLNK(fileInformation->st_mode) && (args->fileTypes & SymbolicLink)) ||
00690                         (S_ISSOCK(fileInformation->st_mode) && (args->fileTypes & Socket));
00691         }
00692         else if (args->filterByUserID)
00693         {
00694                 // TODO
00695                 return false;
00696                 return true;
00697         }
00698         else if (args->filterForNoUser)
00699         {
00700                 // TODO
00701                 return false;
00702                 return true;
00703         }
00704         else if (args->filterForNamePattern)
00705         {
00706                 // TODO
00707                 return false;
00708                 return true;
00709         }
00710         else if (args->filterForPathPattern)
00711         {
00712                 // TODO
00713                 return false;
00714                 return true;
00715         }
00716 
00717         return true;
00718 }

00725 void PrintFileInformation(char* filePath, struct stat* fileInformation, struct Args* args)
00726 {
00727         assert(filePath != NULL);
00728         assert(fileInformation != NULL);
00729         assert(args != NULL);
00730 
00731 
00732         if (args->printInExtendedFormat)
00733         {
00734                 // TODO: Print in extended list format
00735         }
00736         else
00737         {
00738                 // Simply print the path of the file
00739                 printf("%s\n", filePath);
00740         }
00741 }
